revised_title: Geographical and Topographical Survey of the Isthmus of Panama
tldr: The author, John Augustus Lloyd, surveys the Isthmus of Panama to determine the most suitable line of communication between the Pacific and Atlantic oceans. He finds that the Pacific is 13.55 feet higher than the Atlantic at mean tides and 6.51 feet lower at low water. The survey also reveals a break in the mountain chain at the narrowest part of the Isthmus, making it an ideal location for a rail-road connection.
